title-group.article-title: A Globally Uniformly Convergent Finite Element Method for a Singularly Perturbed Elliptic Problem in Two Dimensions

abstract.p: We analyze a new Galerkin finite element method for numerically solving a linear convection-dominated convection-diffusion problem in two dimensions. The method is shown to be convergent, uniformly in the perturbation parameter, of order h<sup>1/2</sup> in a global energy norm which is stronger than the L<sup>2</sup> norm. This order is optimal in this norm for our choice of trial functions.
